intro: Minuartia michauxii var. texana, commonly known as the Texas rockcress, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, typically from March to May. The plant has slender, branching stems covered with small, scale-like leaves that help reduce water loss. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in limestone areas. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
